meanings.definition: Drive or force (someone) to do something
meanings.sent1: The strong wind impelled the sailboat forward.
meanings.sent2: His passion for music impelled him to practice every day.
meanings.sent3: The delicious smell of cookies impelled him to enter the bakery.
meanings.sent4: Her inspiring words impelled me to chase my dreams.
meanings.sent5: The urgent message impelled him to take immediate action.

meanings.definition: Cause (someone) to act in a particular way
meanings.sent1: The teacher's praise impelled the student to work harder.
meanings.sent2: His mischievous grin impelled her to join in the fun.
meanings.sent3: The tempting aroma of fresh bread impelled him to buy a loaf.
meanings.sent4: The heartfelt apology impelled forgiveness from her friend.
meanings.sent5: The exciting news impelled them to celebrate together.

meanings.sent1: The strong current impelled the raft downstream.
meanings.sent2: The engine's power impelled the car up the steep hill.
meanings.sent3: The energetic music impelled the crowd to dance.
meanings.sent4: His determination impelled him to reach the mountain's summit.
meanings.sent5: The cheers from the crowd impelled the team to victory.
